title: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper
text: goal treasury provide simple modern interface US treasury XML feed daily interest rates.

title: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper
text: can install released version treasury CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper
text: treasury functions prefixed tr_ follow naming convention XML feed.
code: library(treasury)  yield_curve <- tr_yield_curve(2023) yield_curve #> # A tibble: 3,250 × 3 #>   date       maturity  rate #>   <date>     <chr>    <dbl> #> 1 2023-01-03 1 month   4.17 #> 2 2023-01-03 2 month   4.42 #> 3 2023-01-03 3 month   4.53 #> 4 2023-01-03 4 month   4.7  #> 5 2023-01-03 6 month   4.77 #> # ℹ 3,245 more rows

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: rates daily secondary market quotations recently auctioned Treasury Bills maturity tranche (4-week, 8-week, 13-week, 17-week, 26-week, 52-week) Treasury currently issues new bills.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: https://home.treasury.gov/treasury-daily-interest-rate-xml-feed

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: date character(1) numeric(1) date format yyyy yyyymm. NULL, data returned. Default NULL.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: data.frame() containing rates NULL entries found.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
text: Market quotations obtained approximately 3:30 PM business day Federal Reserve Bank New York. Bank Discount rate rate bill quoted secondary market based par value, amount discount 360-day year. Coupon Equivalent, also called Bond Equivalent, Investment Yield, bill's yield based purchase price, discount, 365- 366-day year. Coupon Equivalent can used compare yield discount bill yield nominal coupon security pays semiannual interest maturity date.

title: Daily treasury bill rates — tr_bill_rates
code: # \donttest{ # get data for a single month tr_bill_rates("202201") #> # A tibble: 200 × 4 #>    date       type  maturity value #>    <date>     <chr> <chr>    <dbl> #>  1 2022-01-03 close 4 weeks   0.05 #>  2 2022-01-03 yield 4 weeks   0.05 #>  3 2022-01-03 close 8 weeks   0.06 #>  4 2022-01-03 yield 8 weeks   0.06 #>  5 2022-01-03 close 13 weeks  0.09 #>  6 2022-01-03 yield 13 weeks  0.09 #>  7 2022-01-03 close 26 weeks  0.22 #>  8 2022-01-03 yield 26 weeks  0.22 #>  9 2022-01-03 close 52 weeks  0.39 #> 10 2022-01-03 yield 52 weeks  0.4  #> # ℹ 190 more rows # or for the entire year tr_bill_rates(2022) #> # A tibble: 2,590 × 4 #>    date       type  maturity value #>    <date>     <chr> <chr>    <dbl> #>  1 2022-01-03 close 4 weeks   0.05 #>  2 2022-01-03 yield 4 weeks   0.05 #>  3 2022-01-03 close 8 weeks   0.06 #>  4 2022-01-03 yield 8 weeks   0.06 #>  5 2022-01-03 close 13 weeks  0.09 #>  6 2022-01-03 yield 13 weeks  0.09 #>  7 2022-01-03 close 26 weeks  0.22 #>  8 2022-01-03 yield 26 weeks  0.22 #>  9 2022-01-03 close 52 weeks  0.39 #> 10 2022-01-03 yield 52 weeks  0.4  #> # ℹ 2,580 more rows # }

what: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates — tr_curve_rates
title: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates — tr_curve_rates
text: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates

title: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates — tr_curve_rates
code: tr_curve_rates(   x = c("hqm", "tnc", "trc", "tbi"),   type = c("monthly", "end-of-month"),   year = NULL )  tr_par_yields(x = c("hqm", "tnc", "trc"), type = c("monthly", "end-of-month"))  tr_forward_rate(   x = c("tnc", "trc", "tbi"),   type = c("monthly", "end-of-month") )

title: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates — tr_curve_rates
text: https://home.treasury.gov/data/treasury-coupon-issues--corporate-bond-yield-curve/corporate-bond-yield-curve

title: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates — tr_curve_rates
text: x character(1). Defaults "hqm". One : "hqm": Treasury High Quality Market (HQM) Corporate Bond Yield Curve. "tnc": Treasury Nominal Coupon-Issue (TNC) Yield Curve. "trc": Treasury Real Coupon-Issue (TRC) Yield Curve. "tbi": Treasury Breakeven Inflation (TBI) Curve. type character(1). Either "monthly" "end--month". Default "monthly". year integer(1). Year download. Default NULL. NULL, available years downloaded.

title: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates — tr_curve_rates
text: data.frame() following columns: yearmonth, maturity, rate.

title: Download Treasury Yield Curve Rates — tr_curve_rates
Daily treasury long-term rates — tr_long_term_rate
text: Treasury ceased publication 30-year constant maturity series February 18, 2002 resumed series February 9, 2006. estimate 30-year rate time frame, series includes Treasury 20-year Constant Maturity rate "adjustment factor," may added 20-year rate estimate 30-year rate period time Treasury issue 30-year bonds.

what: Daily treasury par real yield curve rates — tr_real_yield_curve
title: Daily treasury par real yield curve rates — tr_real_yield_curve
text: par real curve, relates par real yield Treasury Inflation Protected Security (TIPS) time maturity, based closing market bid prices recently auctioned TIPS --counter market. par real yields derived input market prices, indicative quotations obtained Federal Reserve Bank New York approximately 3:30 PM business day. Treasury began publishing series January 2, 2004. time Treasury released 1 year historical data.

what: treasury: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper — treasury-package
title: treasury: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper — treasury-package
text: Download daily interest rates US Treasury XML feed. Leveraging https://home.treasury.gov/treasury-daily-interest-rate-xml-feed, package serves wrapper, facilitating retrieval daily treasury rates across various categories, including par yield curves, treasury bills, long-term rates, real yield curves.

title: treasury: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper — treasury-package
text: Maintainer: Maximilian Muecke muecke.maximilian@gmail.com (ORCID)
